TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , PERSON , succeeded by PERSON in that function .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant and his wife are retired and receive an old age pension CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) per month , which forms their main source of income . On DATE the applicant acquired a trade licence for inter alia operating a merrygoround for children . The licence became operative on DATE . Since then , the applicant has operated a merry - go - round in DATE , that is DATE . According to the applicant , he earns about SKK CARDINAL per month of operation .

A holder of a trade license is considered as a selfemployed person for the purposes of ORG no . CARDINAL Coll . ( PERSON o NORP poisťovni - “ the LAW ” ) and is obliged to register with the health insurance fund and the pension fund , and to pay DATE contributions to both funds .

Under Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( e ) of LAW as in force until DATE , holders of a trade licence who where receiving an old age pension were exempted from the obligation to contribute to the pension fund .

As the applicant was receiving an oldage pension , he was exempted from the obligation to pay premiums to the pension fund . He did , however , remain obliged to register with the health insurance fund and to pay the DATE contributions to this fund , none of which he in fact did . The applicant did declare his income earned from the exploitation of the merry - go - round to the DATE authorities . According to his income tax declarations , this taxable income was SKK DATE , SKK CARDINAL in DATE and SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL in DATE .

On DATE an amendment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . of the CARDINAL/CARDINAL Act entered into force . It repealed the exemption set forth in Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( e ) of the CARDINAL/CARDINAL Act . Consequently , in addition to his obligation to pay contributions to the health insurance fund , the applicant became liable to contribute to the pension fund as well .

In DATE the applicant registered with the health insurance fund and with the pension fund at ORG ( Sociálna poisťovňa ) . He indicated DATE as the starting date of his participation in the social security scheme on grounds of his selfemployment activity .

On DATE the applicant complained to ORG ( Ústavný súd ) that his DATE income from exploiting the merrygoround amounted to ORG whilst his mandatory contributions payable to ORG were calculated on the minimum assessment basis of SKK CARDINAL thus amounting to SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( i.e. PERCENT for the health insurance scheme plus PERCENT for the pension scheme ) DATE . The applicant alleged that the relevant provisions of ORG violated his property rights .

The applicant complained numerous times , including by letters of CARDINAL April , CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE , to various bodies of ORG that the level of contributions that he was required to pay was excessive in relation to his actual income and that he was required to pay contributions even for DATE in which he did not operate his business .

On various occasions in DATE and DATE , including in a letter of CARDINAL DATE and during a meeting held on CARDINAL May , ORG informed the applicant of the legal rules that applied to his selfemployment activity . It informed him in particular that since DATE , when he had started the operation of the merrygoround , he had been obliged to contribute to the health insurance fund in an amount equivalent to PERCENT of the above minimum assessment basis . It further informed the applicant that , as from DATE , he had further become obliged to contribute to the pension fund by CARDINAL % of that basis . ORG asked the applicant to pay the contributions due , including the arrears .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint on the ground that the applicant had no standing to bring proceedings challenging the constitutionality of legislation .
By letters of DATE and DATE ORG reminded the applicant of his obligation to pay the outstanding contributions .
On DATE the applicant and ORG agreed on a schedule for payment of the outstanding contributions .
Under LAW CARDINAL and QUANTITY , selfemployed persons are liable to pay contributions to the health insurance fund and the pension fund .

Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( e ) of the LAW , as in force until DATE , provided that selfemployed persons in receipt of an oldage pension were exempted from the obligation to contribute to the pension fund . This exemption was abolished on DATE when the amendment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . entered into force .

According to LAW the contributions are a percentage of the “ assessment basis ” ( vymeriavací základ ) . The percentages applicable to selfemployed persons are PERCENT for the health insurance fund and PERCENT for the pension fund ( LAW of the LAW ) .

The “ assessment basis ” is PERCENT of the average DATE taxable income gained by a self - employed person during DATE ( Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL in conjunction with Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Act ) . However , regardless of income actually earned during DATE , a personal “ assessment basis ” for a selfemployed person can not be lower than the statutory defined “ minimum assessment basis ” , that is SKK CARDINAL until DATE , SKK CARDINAL from DATE to CARDINAL DATE and SKK CARDINAL since DATE .

Pursuant to LAW , selfemployed persons are inter alia obliged to register themselves with the local branch of ORG within DATE from the date on which their licence for their selfemployment activity takes effect .
